description: This course builds on the fundamentals of solid mechanics taught in MEAM 210 and addresses more advanced problems in strength of materials. The students will be exposed to a wide array of applications from traditional engineering disciplines as well as emerging areas such as biotechnology and nanotechnology. The methods of analysis developed in this course will form the cornerstone of machine design and also more advanced topics in the mechanics of materials.
name: MECHANICS OF SOLIDS

values.comments: This course builds on the fundamentals of solid mechanics taught in MEAM 210 and addresses more advanced problems in strength of materials. The students will be exposed to a wide array of applications from traditional engineering disciplines as well as emerging areas such as biotechnology and nanotechnology. The methods of analysis developed in this course will form the cornerstone of machine design and also more advanced topics in the mechanics of materials.  Generally, students felt that a lot of material was covered during the course, but that the class was also fairly interesting.  Professor Purohit was criticized for being “difficult to follow” by some students. However, others said that he was fairly “engaging in class.” He was described to be “extremely knowledgeable,” but he “[didn’t] show enough examples in class for most students to understand how to do the homework.”  Overall, this course was very difficult for students. Multiple students reported that the average on the second midterm was “below a 50%.” The course also reportedly “curved to a B-.” This course was recommended for majors only.   This review is based on the 5 student comments which were submitted.
